meanings.definition: Not capable or able; lacking the necessary ability or skill.
meanings.sent1: She felt uncapable of solving the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent2: The uncapable student struggled to keep up with the rest of the class.
meanings.sent3: Even with practice, he remained uncapable of juggling more than two balls.
meanings.sent4: Her uncapable hands fumbled with the delicate jewelry, causing it to fall to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The uncapable chef burned every dish he attempted to cook.
